trans-unit.source: Represents an attribute that is associated with the subject of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref>.
The SamlAttribute class corresponds to the `<saml:Attribute>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
A SamlAttribute instance contains <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A> claims for the subject of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>.

For example, a SamlAttribute might contain an `Over21` claim, whose type would be specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> property and whose resource would be specified as a member of the collection in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement.CreatePolicy%2A> method is called, this `Over21` claim is added to the authorization policy that is returned by returned from by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property contains multiple elements then one claim is returned for each element.

SamlAttribute position in the SAML object hierarchy is: <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement> SamlAttribute
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> class using the specified claim.
Use this constructor to convert a claim into a SAML attribute.

To be converted to a SAML attribute, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Right%2A> property must be <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property must be of type <xref:System.String>, and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property must be in the format `namespace/name`.

The following table specifies what the `claim` parameter sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A>, and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> properties to.

|Property|Property of the `claim` parameter used to set the property| |--------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A>|The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property is added to the collection.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>|The portion of the string after the last '/' character in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A>|The portion of the string before the last '/' character in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.|
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that represents an attribute of the subject for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
claim is .
The property of claim is not of type . -or- The property of claim is not . -or- The property of claim does not have a '/' character or it is in the first or last index positions.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> class using the specified attribute name, XML namespace, and attribute values.
The following table specifies the properties that are set by this constructor's parameters.

|Property|Parameter| |--------------|---------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A>|`attributeValues`| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>|`attributeName`| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A>|`attributeNamespace`|
The XML namespace in which the `attributeName` parameter is defined.
The name of the SAML attribute.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> that contains the values of the SAML attribute.
attributeNamespace is .
-or- attributeName is .
-or- attributeValues is .
The property of claim is not of type . -or- The property of claim is not . -or- The property of claim does not have a '/' character or it is in the first or last index positions.
Gets a collection of attribute values for the SAML attribute.
A <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> that contains the set of attribute values for the SAML attribute.
Gets or sets the xsi:type of the values contained in the SAML Attribute.

The AttributeValueXsiType property corresponds to the `type` attribute of the `<saml:AttributeValue>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
This attribute is required.
A string that contains the xsi:type.
The default is <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimValueTypes.String"></xref>.
An attempt to set a value that is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or empty occurs.
-or- An attempt to set a value that is malformed occurs.
Gets a collection of claims that this SAML attribute represents.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions that can specify an attribute about the subject represented by the security token.
Use the ExtractClaims method to convert the SAML attribute into a set of claims.
A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims that this SAML attribute represents.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Gets or sets the name of the SAML attribute.

To specify the values associated with this SAML attribute, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property The Name property corresponds to the `AttributeName` attribute of the `<Attribute>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The name of the SAML attribute.
The Name property is set and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.IsReadOnly*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
The Name property is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the XML namespace in which the name of the SAML attribute is defined.
To set the name of the SAML attribute, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A> property.

The Namespace property corresponds to the `AttributeNamespace` attribute of the `<AttributeDesignator>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The XML namespace in which the name of the SAML attribute is defined.
Gets or sets the string that represents the OriginalIssuer of the SAML attribute.
The original issuer of the SAML attribute.
An attempt to set a value that is an empty string occurs.
Reads the SAML attribute from the specified XML reader.

The ReadXml method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> properties.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the SAML attribute.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is .
-or- samlSerializer is .
reader refers to an XML element that does not have the and attributes.
Writes the SAML attribute into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the SAML attribute.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
writer is .
-or- samlSerializer is .
